English: Enables control of goods transfer and service vehicle coverage.
If this is selected, preference will be given to servicing locations within the same district and/or park area as this building
If this is selected, service will be restricted to the districts and/or buildings listed below (and any permitted outside connections).
Add this district to the list of permitted districts
Remove this district from the list of permitted districts
Use the cursor to select a building to add to the list of permitted building
Remove this building from the list of permitted buildings
Add this vehicle to the list of permitted vehicles
Remove this vehicle from the list of permitted vehicles
Enable to ensure that the building can always service the same district and/or area that it's in, even if the district or area later changes.
Permit this building to import from outside connections. This is not affected by district or building restrictions.
Permit this building to export to outside connections. This is not affected by district or building restrictions.
Selecting this will reserve a portion of this building's delivery vehicles to only service unique factories
Selecting this will reserve a portion of this building's delivery vehicles to only service outside connections (importing and exporting)
Selecting this will reserve a portion of this building's delivery vehicles to only service delivery within this city (and not be available for importing or exporting)
Set the number of reserved vehicles
If this is selected the mod will use a custom alogorithm to better match transfers based on closest distance.

Use this to adjust the matching algorithm's aggressiveness in trying to find a physically close match.  100% (default) is the same as the unmodded game; lower values will mean the game spends more time and effort trying to find the match with the shortest distance, at the expense of some performance.

Use this to encourage the algorithm to give higher priority to transfers to and from warehouses (over other available options for the same type of cargo).  0 (no warehouse priority) is the default, for the same behavior as the unmodded game; 4 gives a very high priority for warehouse transfers.

Use this to encourage the algorithm to give higher priority to transfers to and from outside rail connections (over other available options for the same type of cargo).  0 (no priority) is the default, for the same behavior as the unmodded game; 4 gives a very high priority for outside connection rail transfers.

Use this to encourage the algorithm to give higher priority to transfers to and from outside shipping connections (over other available options for the same type of cargo).  0 (no priority) is the default, for the same behavior as the unmodded game; 4 gives a very high priority for outside connection shipping transfers.
Block offers with recent pathfind failures
Prevents offers from being matched if there's been a vehicle pathfinding failure between the two buildings in the past five minutes
Show matches that were blocked by restrictions
Show matches that were blocked due to a recent pathfinding failure
This match was blocked due to a recent pathfinding failure
Show matches that were blocked because vehicle reservations meant that no vehicle was available
This match was blocked because vehicle reservations meant that no vehicle was available
Show matches that were considered eligible (but may not have been selected for transfer because a closer option was available)
This match was considered eligible (but may not have been selected for transfer because a closer option was available)
Show matches that were selected for transfer (before pathfinding occurs)
This match was selected for transfer (before pathfinding occurs)
This match was blocked by restrictions set on the incoming building
This match was blocked by restrictions set on the outgoing building
This match was blocked by import restrictions
This match was blocked by export restrictions
This means that the mod is not able to operate, and has shut down.
Transfer Controller was unable to complete its required Harmony patches.
Possible causes of this problem include:
The required Harmony 2 mod dependency was not installed
An old and/or broken mod is preventing Harmony 2 from operating properly
Transfer Controller detected a conflict with at least one other mod.
These mods must be removed before Transfer Controller can operate.
Another mod may be trying to apply a conflicting Harmony patch
